00162 /* set breakpoints here when running in debug mode, useful to catch floating point errors */
00163 #if defined(__linux__) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(OSX_SSE_FPE)

00170 #ifndef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
00171 /* handling ctrl-c event in console */
00172 static void blender_esc(int sig)
00173 {
00174     static int count = 0;
00175     
00176     G.afbreek = 1;  /* forces render loop to read queue, not sure if its needed */
00177     
00178     if (sig == 2) {
00179         if (count) {
00180             printf("\nBlender killed\n");
00181             exit(2);
00182         }
00183         printf("\nSent an internal break event. Press ^C again to kill Blender\n");
00184         count++;
00185     }
00186 }
00187 #endif

00189 static int print_version(int UNUSED(argc), const char **UNUSED(argv), void *UNUSED(data))
00190 {
00191     printf(BLEND_VERSION_STRING_FMT);
00192 #ifdef BUILD_DATE
00193     printf("\tbuild date: %s\n", build_date);
00194     printf("\tbuild time: %s\n", build_time);
00195     printf("\tbuild revision: %s\n", build_rev);
00196     printf("\tbuild platform: %s\n", build_platform);
00197     printf("\tbuild type: %s\n", build_type);
00198     printf("\tbuild c flags: %s\n", build_cflags);
00199     printf("\tbuild c++ flags: %s\n", build_cxxflags);
00200     printf("\tbuild link flags: %s\n", build_linkflags);
00201     printf("\tbuild system: %s\n", build_system);
00202 #endif
00203     exit(0);
00204 
00205     return 0;
00206 }

00208 static int print_help(int UNUSED(argc), const char **UNUSED(argv), void *data)
00209 {
00210     bArgs *ba = (bArgs *)data;
00211 
00212     printf(BLEND_VERSION_STRING_FMT);
00213     printf("Usage: blender [args ...] [file] [args ...]\n\n");
00214 
00215     printf("Render Options:\n");
00216     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--background");
00217     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--render-anim");
00218     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--scene");
00219     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--render-frame");
00220     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--frame-start");
00221     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--frame-end");
00222     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--frame-jump");
00223     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--render-output");
00224     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--engine");
00225     
00226     printf("\n");
00227     printf("Format Options:\n");
00228     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--render-format");
00229     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--use-extension");
00230     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--threads");
00231 
00232     printf("\n");
00233     printf("Animation Playback Options:\n");
00234     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-a");
00235                 
00236     printf("\n");
00237     printf("Window Options:\n");
00238     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--window-border");
00239     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--window-borderless");
00240     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--window-geometry");
00241     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--start-console");
00242 
00243     printf("\n");
00244     printf("Game Engine Specific Options:\n");
00245     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-g");
00246 
00247     printf("\n");
00248     printf("Misc Options:\n");
00249     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--debug");
00250     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--debug-fpe");
00251 
00252 #ifdef WITH_FFMPEG
00253     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--debug-ffmpeg");
00254 #endif
00255 
00256 #ifdef WITH_LIBMV
00257     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--debug-libmv");
00258 #endif
00259 
00260     printf("\n");
00261     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--factory-startup");
00262     printf("\n");
00263     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--env-system-config");
00264     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--env-system-datafiles");
00265     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--env-system-scripts");
00266     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--env-system-plugins");
00267     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--env-system-python");
00268     printf("\n");
00269     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-nojoystick");
00270     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-noglsl");
00271     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-noaudio");
00272     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-setaudio");
00273 
00274     printf("\n");
00275 
00276     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--help");
00277 
00278     printf("\n");
00279 
00280     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--enable-autoexec");
00281     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--disable-autoexec");
00282 
00283     printf("\n");
00284 
00285     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--python");
00286     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--python-console");
00287     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--addons");
00288 
00289 #ifdef WIN32
00290     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-R");
00291     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "-r");
00292 #endif
00293     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--version");
00294 
00295     BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(ba, "--");
00296 
00297     printf("Other Options:\n");
00298     BLI_argsPrintOtherDoc(ba);
00299 
00300     printf("Argument Parsing:\n");
00301     printf("\targuments must be separated by white space. eg\n");
00302     printf("\t\t\"blender -ba test.blend\"\n");
00303     printf("\t...will ignore the 'a'\n");
00304     printf("\t\t\"blender -b test.blend -f8\"\n");
00305     printf("\t...will ignore 8 because there is no space between the -f and the frame value\n\n");
00306 
00307     printf("Argument Order:\n");
00308     printf("Arguments are executed in the order they are given. eg\n");
00309     printf("\t\t\"blender --background test.blend --render-frame 1 --render-output /tmp\"\n");
00310     printf("\t...will not render to /tmp because '--render-frame 1' renders before the output path is set\n");
00311     printf("\t\t\"blender --background --render-output /tmp test.blend --render-frame 1\"\n");
00312     printf("\t...will not render to /tmp because loading the blend file overwrites the render output that was set\n");
00313     printf("\t\t\"blender --background test.blend --render-output /tmp --render-frame 1\" works as expected.\n\n");
00314 
00315     printf("\nEnvironment Variables:\n");
00316     printf("  $BLENDER_USER_CONFIG      Directory for user configuration files.\n");
00317     printf("  $BLENDER_USER_SCRIPTS     Directory for user scripts.\n");
00318     printf("  $BLENDER_SYSTEM_SCRIPTS   Directory for system wide scripts.\n");
00319     printf("  $Directory for user data files (icons, translations, ..).\n");
00320     printf("  $BLENDER_SYSTEM_DATAFILES Directory for system wide data files.\n");
00321     printf("  $BLENDER_SYSTEM_PYTHON    Directory for system python libraries.\n");
00322 #ifdef WIN32
00323     printf("  $TEMP                     Store temporary files here.\n");
00324 #else
00325     printf("  $TMP or $TMPDIR           Store temporary files here.\n");
00326 #endif
00327 #ifdef WITH_SDL
00328     printf("  $SDL_AUDIODRIVER          LibSDL audio driver - alsa, esd, dma.\n");
00329 #endif
00330     printf("  $PYTHONHOME               Path to the python directory, eg. /usr/lib/python.\n\n");
00331 
00332     exit(0);
00333 
00334     return 0;
00335 }

00391 static int set_fpe(int UNUSED(argc), const char **UNUSED(argv), void *UNUSED(data))
00392 {
00393 #if defined(__linux__) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(OSX_SSE_FPE)
00394     /* zealous but makes float issues a heck of a lot easier to find!
00395      * set breakpoints on fpe_handler */
00396     signal(SIGFPE, fpe_handler);
00397 
00398 # if defined(__linux__) && defined(__GNUC__)
00399     feenableexcept(FE_DIVBYZERO | FE_INVALID | FE_OVERFLOW);
00400 # endif /* defined(__linux__) && defined(__GNUC__) */
00401 # if defined(OSX_SSE_FPE)
00402     /* OSX uses SSE for floating point by default, so here 
00403      * use SSE instructions to throw floating point exceptions */
00404     _MM_SET_EXCEPTION_MASK(_MM_MASK_MASK & ~
00405                            (_MM_MASK_OVERFLOW | _MM_MASK_INVALID | _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO));
00406 # endif /* OSX_SSE_FPE */
00407 # if defined(_WIN32) && defined(_MSC_VER)
00408     _controlfp_s(NULL, 0, _MCW_EM); /* enables all fp exceptions */
00409     _controlfp_s(NULL, _EM_DENORMAL | _EM_UNDERFLOW | _EM_INEXACT, _MCW_EM); /* hide the ones we don't care about */
00410 # endif /* _WIN32 && _MSC_VER */
00411 #endif
00412 
00413     return 0;
00414 }
00415

00417 {
00418     G.factory_startup = 1;
00419     return 0;

00422 static int set_env(int argc, const char **argv, void *UNUSED(data))
00423 {
00424     /* "--env-system-scripts" --> "BLENDER_SYSTEM_SCRIPTS" */
00425 
00426     char env[64] = "BLENDER";
00427     char *ch_dst = env + 7; /* skip BLENDER */
00428     const char *ch_src = argv[0] + 5; /* skip --env */
00429 
00430     if (argc < 2) {
00431         printf("%s requires one argument\n", argv[0]);
00432         exit(1);
00433     }
00434 
00435     for (; *ch_src; ch_src++, ch_dst++) {
00436         *ch_dst = (*ch_src == '-') ? '_' : (*ch_src) - 32; /* toupper() */
00437     }
00438 
00439     *ch_dst = '\0';
00440     BLI_setenv(env, argv[1]);
00441     return 1;
00442 }

00444 static int playback_mode(int UNUSED(argc), const char **UNUSED(argv), void *UNUSED(data))
00445 {
00446     /* not if -b was given first */
00447     if (G.background == 0) {
00448 #if 0   /* TODO, bring player back? */
00449         playanim(argc, argv); /* not the same argc and argv as before */
00450 #else
00451         fprintf(stderr, "Playback mode not supported in blender 2.6x\n");
00452         exit(0);
00453 #endif
00454     }
00455 
00456     return -2;
00457 }

00459 static int prefsize(int argc, const char **argv, void *UNUSED(data))
00460 {
00461     int stax, stay, sizx, sizy;
00462 
00463     if (argc < 5) {
00464         fprintf(stderr, "-p requires four arguments\n");
00465         exit(1);
00466     }
00467 
00468     stax = atoi(argv[1]);
00469     stay = atoi(argv[2]);
00470     sizx = atoi(argv[3]);
00471     sizy = atoi(argv[4]);
00472 
00473     WM_setprefsize(stax, stay, sizx, sizy);
00474 
00475     return 4;
00476 }

00509 static int no_joystick(int UNUSED(argc), const char **UNUSED(argv), void *data)
00510 {

00513 #else
00514     SYS_SystemHandle *syshandle = data;
00515

00521     if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) printf("disabling nojoystick\n");
00522 #endif
00523 
00524     return 0;

00539 static int set_audio(int argc, const char **argv, void *UNUSED(data))
00540 {
00541     if (argc < 1) {
00542         fprintf(stderr, "-setaudio require one argument\n");
00543         exit(1);
00544     }
00545 
00546     sound_force_device(sound_define_from_str(argv[1]));
00547     return 1;
00548 }
00549 
00550 static int set_output(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00551 {
00552     bContext *C = data;
00553     if (argc >= 1) {
00554         Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00555         if (scene) {
00556             BLI_strncpy(scene->r.pic, argv[1], sizeof(scene->r.pic));
00557         }
00558         else {
00559             printf("\nError: no blend loaded. cannot use '-o / --render-output'.\n");
00560         }
00561         return 1;
00562     }
00563     else {
00564         printf("\nError: you must specify a path after '-o  / --render-output'.\n");
00565         return 0;
00566     }
00567 }
00568 
00569 static int set_engine(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00570 {
00571     bContext *C = data;
00572     if (argc >= 2) {
00573         if (!strcmp(argv[1], "help")) {
00574             RenderEngineType *type = NULL;
00575             printf("Blender Engine Listing:\n");
00576             for (type = R_engines.first; type; type = type->next) {
00577                 printf("\t%s\n", type->idname);
00578             }
00579             exit(0);
00580         }
00581         else {
00582             Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00583             if (scene) {
00584                 RenderData *rd = &scene->r;
00585 
00586                 if (BLI_findstring(&R_engines, argv[1], offsetof(RenderEngineType, idname))) {
00587                     BLI_strncpy_utf8(rd->engine, argv[1], sizeof(rd->engine));
00588                 }
00589             }
00590             else {
00591                 printf("\nError: no blend loaded. order the arguments so '-E  / --engine ' is after a blend is loaded.\n");
00592             }
00593         }
00594 
00595         return 1;
00596     }
00597     else {
00598         printf("\nEngine not specified, give 'help' for a list of available engines.\n");
00599         return 0;
00600     }
00601 }
00602 
00603 static int set_image_type(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00604 {
00605     bContext *C = data;
00606     if (argc >= 1) {
00607         const char *imtype = argv[1];
00608         Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00609         if (scene) {
00610             const char imtype_new = BKE_imtype_from_arg(imtype);
00611 
00612             if (imtype_new == R_IMF_IMTYPE_INVALID) {
00613                 printf("\nError: Format from '-F / --render-format' not known or not compiled in this release.\n");
00614             }
00615             else {
00616                 scene->r.im_format.imtype = imtype_new;
00617             }
00618         }
00619         else {
00620             printf("\nError: no blend loaded. order the arguments so '-F  / --render-format' is after the blend is loaded.\n");
00621         }
00622         return 1;
00623     }
00624     else {
00625         printf("\nError: you must specify a format after '-F  / --render-foramt'.\n");
00626         return 0;
00627     }
00628 }
00629 
00630 static int set_threads(int argc, const char **argv, void *UNUSED(data))
00631 {
00632     if (argc >= 1) {
00633         if (G.background) {
00634             RE_set_max_threads(atoi(argv[1]));
00635         }
00636         else {
00637             printf("Warning: threads can only be set in background mode\n");
00638         }
00639         return 1;
00640     }
00641     else {
00642         printf("\nError: you must specify a number of threads between 0 and 8 '-t  / --threads'.\n");
00643         return 0;
00644     }
00645 }
00646 
00647 static int set_extension(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00648 {
00649     bContext *C = data;
00650     if (argc >= 1) {
00651         Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00652         if (scene) {
00653             if (argv[1][0] == '0') {
00654                 scene->r.scemode &= ~R_EXTENSION;
00655             }
00656             else if (argv[1][0] == '1') {
00657                 scene->r.scemode |= R_EXTENSION;
00658             }
00659             else {
00660                 printf("\nError: Use '-x 1 / -x 0' To set the extension option or '--use-extension'\n");
00661             }
00662         }
00663         else {
00664             printf("\nError: no blend loaded. order the arguments so '-o ' is after '-x '.\n");
00665         }
00666         return 1;
00667     }
00668     else {
00669         printf("\nError: you must specify a path after '- '.\n");
00670         return 0;
00671     }
00672 }
00673 
00674 static int set_ge_parameters(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00675 {
00676     int a = 0;
00677 #ifdef WITH_GAMEENGINE
00678     SYS_SystemHandle syshandle = *(SYS_SystemHandle *)data;
00679 #else
00680     (void)data;
00681 #endif
00682 
00692     if (argc >= 1) {
00693         const char *paramname = argv[a];
00694         /* check for single value versus assignment */
00695         if (a + 1 < argc && (*(argv[a + 1]) == '=')) {
00696             a++;
00697             if (a + 1 < argc) {
00698                 a++;
00699                 /* assignment */
00700 #ifdef WITH_GAMEENGINE
00701                 SYS_WriteCommandLineString(syshandle, paramname, argv[a]);
00702 #endif
00703             }
00704             else {
00705                 printf("error: argument assignment (%s) without value.\n", paramname);
00706                 return 0;
00707             }
00708             /* name arg eaten */
00709 
00710         }
00711         else {
00712 #ifdef WITH_GAMEENGINE
00713             SYS_WriteCommandLineInt(syshandle, argv[a], 1);
00714 #endif
00715             /* doMipMap */
00716             if (!strcmp(argv[a], "nomipmap")) {
00717                 GPU_set_mipmap(0); //doMipMap = 0;
00718             }
00719             /* linearMipMap */
00720             if (!strcmp(argv[a], "linearmipmap")) {
00721                 GPU_set_linear_mipmap(1); //linearMipMap = 1;
00722             }
00723 
00724 
00725         } /* if (*(argv[a+1]) == '=') */
00726     }
00727 
00728     return a;
00729 }
00730 
00731 static int render_frame(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00732 {
00733     bContext *C = data;
00734     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00735     if (scene) {
00736         Main *bmain = CTX_data_main(C);
00737 
00738         if (argc > 1) {
00739             Render *re = RE_NewRender(scene->id.name);
00740             int frame;
00741             ReportList reports;
00742 
00743             switch (*argv[1]) {
00744                 case '+':
00745                     frame = scene->r.sfra + atoi(argv[1] + 1);
00746                     break;
00747                 case '-':
00748                     frame = (scene->r.efra - atoi(argv[1] + 1)) + 1;
00749                     break;
00750                 default:
00751                     frame = atoi(argv[1]);
00752                     break;
00753             }
00754 
00755             BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_PRINT);
00756 
00757             frame = CLAMPIS(frame, MINAFRAME, MAXFRAME);
00758 
00759             RE_SetReports(re, &reports);
00760             RE_BlenderAnim(re, bmain, scene, NULL, scene->lay, frame, frame, scene->r.frame_step);
00761             RE_SetReports(re, NULL);
00762             return 1;
00763         }
00764         else {
00765             printf("\nError: frame number must follow '-f / --render-frame'.\n");
00766             return 0;
00767         }
00768     }
00769     else {
00770         printf("\nError: no blend loaded. cannot use '-f / --render-frame'.\n");
00771         return 0;
00772     }
00773 }
00774 
00775 static int render_animation(int UNUSED(argc), const char **UNUSED(argv), void *data)
00776 {
00777     bContext *C = data;
00778     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00779     if (scene) {
00780         Main *bmain = CTX_data_main(C);
00781         Render *re = RE_NewRender(scene->id.name);
00782         ReportList reports;
00783         BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_PRINT);
00784         RE_SetReports(re, &reports);
00785         RE_BlenderAnim(re, bmain, scene, NULL, scene->lay, scene->r.sfra, scene->r.efra, scene->r.frame_step);
00786         RE_SetReports(re, NULL);
00787     }
00788     else {
00789         printf("\nError: no blend loaded. cannot use '-a'.\n");
00790     }
00791     return 0;
00792 }
00793 
00794 static int set_scene(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00795 {
00796     if (argc > 1) {
00797         bContext *C = data;
00798         Scene *scene = set_scene_name(CTX_data_main(C), argv[1]);
00799         if (scene) {
00800             CTX_data_scene_set(C, scene);
00801         }
00802         return 1;
00803     }
00804     else {
00805         printf("\nError: Scene name must follow '-S / --scene'.\n");
00806         return 0;
00807     }
00808 }
00809 
00810 static int set_start_frame(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00811 {
00812     bContext *C = data;
00813     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00814     if (scene) {
00815         if (argc > 1) {
00816             int frame = atoi(argv[1]);
00817             (scene->r.sfra) = CLAMPIS(frame, MINFRAME, MAXFRAME);
00818             return 1;
00819         }
00820         else {
00821             printf("\nError: frame number must follow '-s / --frame-start'.\n");
00822             return 0;
00823         }
00824     }
00825     else {
00826         printf("\nError: no blend loaded. cannot use '-s / --frame-start'.\n");
00827         return 0;
00828     }
00829 }
00830 
00831 static int set_end_frame(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00832 {
00833     bContext *C = data;
00834     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00835     if (scene) {
00836         if (argc > 1) {
00837             int frame = atoi(argv[1]);
00838             (scene->r.efra) = CLAMPIS(frame, MINFRAME, MAXFRAME);
00839             return 1;
00840         }
00841         else {
00842             printf("\nError: frame number must follow '-e / --frame-end'.\n");
00843             return 0;
00844         }
00845     }
00846     else {
00847         printf("\nError: no blend loaded. cannot use '-e / --frame-end'.\n");
00848         return 0;
00849     }
00850 }
00851 
00852 static int set_skip_frame(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00853 {
00854     bContext *C = data;
00855     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00856     if (scene) {
00857         if (argc > 1) {
00858             int frame = atoi(argv[1]);
00859             (scene->r.frame_step) = CLAMPIS(frame, 1, MAXFRAME);
00860             return 1;
00861         }
00862         else {
00863             printf("\nError: number of frames to step must follow '-j / --frame-jump'.\n");
00864             return 0;
00865         }
00866     }
00867     else {
00868         printf("\nError: no blend loaded. cannot use '-j / --frame-jump'.\n");
00869         return 0;
00870     }
00871 }
00872 
00873 /* macro for ugly context setup/reset */
00874 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00875 #define BPY_CTX_SETUP(_cmd)                                                   \
00876     {                                                                         \
00877         wmWindowManager *wm = CTX_wm_manager(C);                              \
00878         wmWindow *prevwin = CTX_wm_window(C);                                 \
00879         Scene *prevscene = CTX_data_scene(C);                                 \
00880         if (wm->windows.first) {                                              \
00881             CTX_wm_window_set(C, wm->windows.first);                          \
00882             _cmd;                                                             \
00883             CTX_wm_window_set(C, prevwin);                                    \
00884         }                                                                     \
00885         else {                                                                \
00886             fprintf(stderr, "Python script \"%s\" "                           \
00887                     "running with missing context data.\n", argv[1]);         \
00888             _cmd;                                                             \
00889         }                                                                     \
00890         CTX_data_scene_set(C, prevscene);                                     \
00891     }                                                                         \
00892 
00893 #endif /* WITH_PYTHON */
00894 
00895 static int run_python(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00896 {
00897 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00898     bContext *C = data;
00899 
00900     /* workaround for scripts not getting a bpy.context.scene, causes internal errors elsewhere */
00901     if (argc > 1) {
00902         /* Make the path absolute because its needed for relative linked blends to be found */
00903         char filename[FILE_MAX];
00904         BLI_strncpy(filename, argv[1], sizeof(filename));
00905         BLI_path_cwd(filename);
00906 
00907         BPY_CTX_SETUP(BPY_filepath_exec(C, filename, NULL))
00908 
00909         return 1;
00910     }
00911     else {
00912         printf("\nError: you must specify a Python script after '-P / --python'.\n");
00913         return 0;
00914     }
00915 #else
00916     (void)argc; (void)argv; (void)data; /* unused */
00917     printf("This blender was built without python support\n");
00918     return 0;
00919 #endif /* WITH_PYTHON */
00920 }
00921 
00922 static int run_python_console(int UNUSED(argc), const char **argv, void *data)
00923 {
00924 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00925     bContext *C = data;
00926 
00927     BPY_CTX_SETUP(BPY_string_exec(C, "__import__('code').interact()"))
00928 
00929     return 0;
00930 #else
00931     (void)argv; (void)data; /* unused */
00932     printf("This blender was built without python support\n");
00933     return 0;
00934 #endif /* WITH_PYTHON */
00935 }
00936 
00937 static int set_addons(int argc, const char **argv, void *data)
00938 {
00939     /* workaround for scripts not getting a bpy.context.scene, causes internal errors elsewhere */
00940     if (argc > 1) {
00941 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00942         const int slen = strlen(argv[1]) + 128;
00943         char *str = malloc(slen);
00944         bContext *C = data;
00945         BLI_snprintf(str, slen, "[__import__('addon_utils').enable(i, default_set=False) for i in '%s'.split(',')]", argv[1]);
00946         BPY_CTX_SETUP(BPY_string_exec(C, str));
00947         free(str);
00948 #else
00949         (void)argv; (void)data; /* unused */
00950 #endif /* WITH_PYTHON */
00951         return 1;
00952     }
00953     else {
00954         printf("\nError: you must specify a comma separated list after '--addons'.\n");
00955         return 0;
00956     }
00957 }
00958 
00959 
00960 static int load_file(int UNUSED(argc), const char **argv, void *data)
00961 {
00962     bContext *C = data;
00963 
00964     /* Make the path absolute because its needed for relative linked blends to be found */
00965     char filename[FILE_MAX];
00966 
00967     /* note, we could skip these, but so far we always tried to load these files */
00968     if (argv[0][0] == '-') {
00969         fprintf(stderr, "unknown argument, loading as file: %s\n", argv[0]);
00970     }
00971 
00972     BLI_strncpy(filename, argv[0], sizeof(filename));
00973     BLI_path_cwd(filename);
00974 
00975     if (G.background) {
00976         int retval = BKE_read_file(C, filename, NULL);
00977 
00978         /* we successfully loaded a blend file, get sure that
00979          * pointcache works */
00980         if (retval != BKE_READ_FILE_FAIL) {
00981             wmWindowManager *wm = CTX_wm_manager(C);
00982 
00983             /* special case, 2.4x files */
00984             if (wm == NULL && CTX_data_main(C)->wm.first == NULL) {
00985                 extern void wm_add_default(bContext *C);
00986 
00987                 /* wm_add_default() needs the screen to be set. */
00988                 CTX_wm_screen_set(C, CTX_data_main(C)->screen.first);
00989                 wm_add_default(C);
00990             }
00991 
00992             CTX_wm_manager_set(C, NULL); /* remove wm to force check */
00993             WM_check(C);
00994             G.relbase_valid = 1;
00995             if (CTX_wm_manager(C) == NULL) CTX_wm_manager_set(C, wm);  /* reset wm */
00996 
00997             DAG_on_visible_update(CTX_data_main(C), TRUE);
00998         }
00999         else {
01000             /* failed to load file, stop processing arguments */
01001             return -1;
01002         }
01003 
01004         /* WM_read_file() runs normally but since we're in background mode do here */
01005 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
01006         /* run any texts that were loaded in and flagged as modules */
01007         BPY_driver_reset();
01008         BPY_app_handlers_reset(FALSE);
01009         BPY_modules_load_user(C);
01010 #endif
01011 
01012         /* happens for the UI on file reading too (huh? (ton))*/
01013         // XXX      BKE_reset_undo();
01014         //          BKE_write_undo("original"); /* save current state */
01015     }
01016     else {
01017         /* we are not running in background mode here, but start blender in UI mode with
01018          * a file - this should do everything a 'load file' does */
01019         ReportList reports;
01020         BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_PRINT);
01021         WM_read_file(C, filename, &reports);
01022         BKE_reports_clear(&reports);
01023     }
01024 
01025     G.file_loaded = 1;
01026 
01027     return 0;
01028 }
01029 
01030 static void setupArguments(bContext *C, bArgs *ba, SYS_SystemHandle *syshandle)
01031 {
01032     static char output_doc[] = "<path>"
01033         "\n\tSet the render path and file name."
01034         "\n\tUse // at the start of the path to"
01035         "\n\t\trender relative to the blend file."
01036         "\n\tThe # characters are replaced by the frame number, and used to define zero padding."
01037         "\n\t\tani_##_test.png becomes ani_01_test.png"
01038         "\n\t\ttest-######.png becomes test-000001.png"
01039         "\n\t\tWhen the filename does not contain #, The suffix #### is added to the filename"
01040         "\n\tThe frame number will be added at the end of the filename."
01041         "\n\t\teg: blender -b foobar.blend -o //render_ -F PNG -x 1 -a"
01042         "\n\t\t//render_ becomes //render_####, writing frames as //render_0001.png//";
01043 
01044     static char format_doc[] = "<format>"
01045         "\n\tSet the render format, Valid options are..."
01046         "\n\t\tTGA IRIS JPEG MOVIE IRIZ RAWTGA"
01047         "\n\t\tAVIRAW AVIJPEG PNG BMP FRAMESERVER"
01048         "\n\t(formats that can be compiled into blender, not available on all systems)"
01049         "\n\t\tHDR TIFF EXR MULTILAYER MPEG AVICODEC QUICKTIME CINEON DPX DDS";
01050 
01051     static char playback_doc[] = "<options> <file(s)>"
01052         "\n\tPlayback <file(s)>, only operates this way when not running in background."
01053         "\n\t\t-p <sx> <sy>\tOpen with lower left corner at <sx>, <sy>"
01054         "\n\t\t-m\t\tRead from disk (Don't buffer)"
01055         "\n\t\t-f <fps> <fps-base>\t\tSpecify FPS to start with"
01056         "\n\t\t-j <frame>\tSet frame step to <frame>";
01057 
01058     static char game_doc[] = "Game Engine specific options"
01059         "\n\t-g fixedtime\t\tRun on 50 hertz without dropping frames"
01060         "\n\t-g vertexarrays\t\tUse Vertex Arrays for rendering (usually faster)"
01061         "\n\t-g nomipmap\t\tNo Texture Mipmapping"
01062         "\n\t-g linearmipmap\t\tLinear Texture Mipmapping instead of Nearest (default)";
01063 
01064     static char debug_doc[] = "\n\tTurn debugging on\n"
01065         "\n\t* Prints every operator call and their arguments"
01066         "\n\t* Disables mouse grab (to interact with a debugger in some cases)"
01067         "\n\t* Keeps python sys.stdin rather than setting it to None";
01068 
01069     //BLI_argsAdd(ba, pass, short_arg, long_arg, doc, cb, C);
01070 
01071     /* end argument processing after -- */
01072     BLI_argsAdd(ba, -1, "--", NULL, "\n\tEnds option processing, following arguments passed unchanged. Access via python's sys.argv", end_arguments, NULL);
01073 
01074     /* first pass: background mode, disable python and commands that exit after usage */
01075     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-h", "--help", "\n\tPrint this help text and exit", print_help, ba);
01076     /* Windows only */
01077     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "/?", NULL, "\n\tPrint this help text and exit (windows only)", print_help, ba);
01078 
01079     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-v", "--version", "\n\tPrint Blender version and exit", print_version, NULL);
01080     
01081     /* only to give help message */
01082 #ifndef WITH_PYTHON_SECURITY /* default */
01083 #  define   PY_ENABLE_AUTO ", (default)"
01084 #  define   PY_DISABLE_AUTO ""
01085 #else
01086 #  define   PY_ENABLE_AUTO ""
01087 #  define   PY_DISABLE_AUTO ", (compiled as non-standard default)"
01088 #endif
01089 
01090     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-y", "--enable-autoexec", "\n\tEnable automatic python script execution" PY_ENABLE_AUTO, enable_python, NULL);
01091     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-Y", "--disable-autoexec", "\n\tDisable automatic python script execution (pydrivers, pyconstraints, pynodes)" PY_DISABLE_AUTO, disable_python, NULL);
01092 
01093 #undef PY_ENABLE_AUTO
01094 #undef PY_DISABLE_AUTO
01095     
01096     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-b", "--background", "<file>\n\tLoad <file> in background (often used for UI-less rendering)", background_mode, NULL);
01097 
01098     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-a", NULL, playback_doc, playback_mode, NULL);
01099 
01100     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, "-d", "--debug", debug_doc, debug_mode, ba);
01101 #ifdef WITH_FFMPEG
01102     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-ffmpeg", "\n\tEnable debug messages from FFmpeg library", debug_mode_generic, (void *)G_DEBUG_FFMPEG);
01103 #endif
01104     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-python", "\n\tEnable debug messages for python", debug_mode_generic, (void *)G_DEBUG_FFMPEG);
01105     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-events", "\n\tEnable debug messages for the event system", debug_mode_generic, (void *)G_DEBUG_EVENTS);
01106     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-wm",     "\n\tEnable debug messages for the window manager", debug_mode_generic, (void *)G_DEBUG_WM);
01107     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-all",    "\n\tEnable all debug messages (excludes libmv)", debug_mode_generic, (void *)G_DEBUG_ALL);
01108 
01109     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-fpe", "\n\tEnable floating point exceptions", set_fpe, NULL);
01110 
01111 #ifdef WITH_LIBMV
01112     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--debug-libmv", "\n\tEnable debug messages from libmv library", debug_mode_libmv, NULL);
01113 #endif
01114 
01115     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--factory-startup", "\n\tSkip reading the "STRINGIFY (BLENDER_STARTUP_FILE)" in the users home directory", set_factory_startup, NULL);
01116 
01117     /* TODO, add user env vars? */
01118     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--env-system-datafiles",  "\n\tSet the "STRINGIFY_ARG (BLENDER_SYSTEM_DATAFILES)" environment variable", set_env, NULL);
01119     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--env-system-scripts",    "\n\tSet the "STRINGIFY_ARG (BLENDER_SYSTEM_SCRIPTS)" environment variable", set_env, NULL);
01120     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--env-system-plugins",    "\n\tSet the "STRINGIFY_ARG (BLENDER_SYSTEM_PLUGINS)" environment variable", set_env, NULL);
01121     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 1, NULL, "--env-system-python",     "\n\tSet the "STRINGIFY_ARG (BLENDER_SYSTEM_PYTHON)" environment variable", set_env, NULL);
01122 
01123     /* second pass: custom window stuff */
01124     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 2, "-p", "--window-geometry", "<sx> <sy> <w> <h>\n\tOpen with lower left corner at <sx>, <sy> and width and height as <w>, <h>", prefsize, NULL);
01125     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 2, "-w", "--window-border", "\n\tForce opening with borders (default)", with_borders, NULL);
01126     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 2, "-W", "--window-borderless", "\n\tForce opening without borders", without_borders, NULL);
01127     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 2, "-con", "--start-console", "\n\tStart with the console window open (ignored if -b is set)", start_with_console, NULL);
01128     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 2, "-R", NULL, "\n\tRegister .blend extension, then exit (Windows only)", register_extension, NULL);
01129     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 2, "-r", NULL, "\n\tSilently register .blend extension, then exit (Windows only)", register_extension, ba);
01130 
01131     /* third pass: disabling things and forcing settings */
01132     BLI_argsAddCase(ba, 3, "-nojoystick", 1, NULL, 0, "\n\tDisable joystick support", no_joystick, syshandle);
01133     BLI_argsAddCase(ba, 3, "-noglsl", 1, NULL, 0, "\n\tDisable GLSL shading", no_glsl, NULL);
01134     BLI_argsAddCase(ba, 3, "-noaudio", 1, NULL, 0, "\n\tForce sound system to None", no_audio, NULL);
01135     BLI_argsAddCase(ba, 3, "-setaudio", 1, NULL, 0, "\n\tForce sound system to a specific device\n\tNULL SDL OPENAL JACK", set_audio, NULL);
01136 
01137     /* fourth pass: processing arguments */
01138     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-g", NULL, game_doc, set_ge_parameters, syshandle);
01139     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-f", "--render-frame", "<frame>\n\tRender frame <frame> and save it.\n\t+<frame> start frame relative, -<frame> end frame relative.", render_frame, C);
01140     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-a", "--render-anim", "\n\tRender frames from start to end (inclusive)", render_animation, C);
01141     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-S", "--scene", "<name>\n\tSet the active scene <name> for rendering", set_scene, C);
01142     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-s", "--frame-start", "<frame>\n\tSet start to frame <frame> (use before the -a argument)", set_start_frame, C);
01143     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-e", "--frame-end", "<frame>\n\tSet end to frame <frame> (use before the -a argument)", set_end_frame, C);
01144     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-j", "--frame-jump", "<frames>\n\tSet number of frames to step forward after each rendered frame", set_skip_frame, C);
01145     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-P", "--python", "<filename>\n\tRun the given Python script (filename or Blender Text)", run_python, C);
01146     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, NULL, "--python-console", "\n\tRun blender with an interactive console", run_python_console, C);
01147     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, NULL, "--addons", "\n\tComma separated list of addons (no spaces)", set_addons, C);
01148 
01149     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-o", "--render-output", output_doc, set_output, C);
01150     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-E", "--engine", "<engine>\n\tSpecify the render engine\n\tuse -E help to list available engines", set_engine, C);
01151 
01152     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-F", "--render-format", format_doc, set_image_type, C);
01153     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-t", "--threads", "<threads>\n\tUse amount of <threads> for rendering in background\n\t[1-" STRINGIFY(BLENDER_MAX_THREADS) "], 0 for systems processor count.", set_threads, NULL);
01154     BLI_argsAdd(ba, 4, "-x", "--use-extension", "<bool>\n\tSet option to add the file extension to the end of the file", set_extension, C);
01155 
01156 }

01158 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
01159 /* allow python module to call main */
01160 #define main main_python_enter
01161 static void *evil_C = NULL;
01162 
01163 #ifdef __APPLE__
01164 /* environ is not available in mac shared libraries */
01165 #include <crt_externs.h>
01166 char **environ = NULL;
01167 #endif
01168 
01169 #endif

01171 
01172 #ifdef WIN32
01173 int main(int argc, const char **UNUSED(argv_c)) /* Do not mess with const */
01174 #else
01175 int main(int argc, const char **argv)
01176 #endif
01177 {
01178     SYS_SystemHandle syshandle;
01179     bContext *C = CTX_create();
01180     bArgs *ba;
01181 
01182 #ifdef WIN32
01183     wchar_t **argv_16 = CommandLineToArgvW(GetCommandLineW(), &argc);
01184     int argci = 0;
01185     char **argv = MEM_mallocN(argc * sizeof(char *), "argv array");
01186     for (argci = 0; argci < argc; argci++) {
01187         argv[argci] = alloc_utf_8_from_16(argv_16[argci], 0);
01188     }
01189     LocalFree(argv_16);
01190 #endif  
01191 
01192 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
01193 #ifdef __APPLE__
01194     environ = *_NSGetEnviron();
01195 #endif
01196 
01197 #undef main
01198     evil_C = C;
01199 #endif
01200 
01201 
01202 
01203 #ifdef WITH_BINRELOC
01204     br_init(NULL);
01205 #endif
01206 
01207 #ifdef WITH_LIBMV
01208     libmv_initLogging(argv[0]);
01209 #endif
01210 
01211     setCallbacks();
01212 #if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(WITH_PYTHON_MODULE)
01213     /* patch to ignore argument finder gives us (pid?) */
01214     if (argc == 2 && strncmp(argv[1], "-psn_", 5) == 0) {
01215         extern int GHOST_HACK_getFirstFile(char buf[]);
01216         static char firstfilebuf[512];
01217 
01218         argc = 1;
01219 
01220         if (GHOST_HACK_getFirstFile(firstfilebuf)) {
01221             argc = 2;
01222             argv[1] = firstfilebuf;
01223         }
01224     }
01225 
01226 #endif
01227 
01228 #ifdef __FreeBSD__
01229     fpsetmask(0);
01230 #endif
01231 
01232     /* initialize path to executable */
01233     BLI_init_program_path(argv[0]);
01234 
01235     BLI_threadapi_init();
01236 
01237     RNA_init();
01238     RE_engines_init();
01239 
01240     /* Hack - force inclusion of the plugin api functions,
01241      * see blenpluginapi:pluginapi.c
01242      */
01243     pluginapi_force_ref();
01244 
01245     init_nodesystem();
01246     
01247     initglobals();  /* blender.c */
01248 
01249     IMB_init();
01250 
01251     BLI_cb_init();
01252 
01253 #ifdef WITH_GAMEENGINE
01254     syshandle = SYS_GetSystem();
01255 #else
01256     syshandle = 0;
01257 #endif
01258 
01259     /* first test for background */
01260     ba = BLI_argsInit(argc, (const char **)argv); /* skip binary path */
01261     setupArguments(C, ba, &syshandle);
01262 
01263     BLI_argsParse(ba, 1, NULL, NULL);
01264 
01265 #if defined(WITH_PYTHON_MODULE) || defined(WITH_HEADLESS)
01266     G.background = 1; /* python module mode ALWAYS runs in background mode (for now) */
01267 #else
01268     /* for all platforms, even windos has it! */
01269     if (G.background) signal(SIGINT, blender_esc);  /* ctrl c out bg render */
01270 #endif
01271 
01272     /* background render uses this font too */
01273     BKE_font_register_builtin(datatoc_Bfont, datatoc_Bfont_size);
01274 
01275     /* Initialize ffmpeg if built in, also needed for bg mode if videos are
01276      * rendered via ffmpeg */
01277     sound_init_once();
01278     
01279     init_def_material();
01280 
01281     if (G.background == 0) {
01282         BLI_argsParse(ba, 2, NULL, NULL);
01283         BLI_argsParse(ba, 3, NULL, NULL);
01284 
01285         WM_init(C, argc, (const char **)argv);
01286 
01287         /* this is properly initialized with user defs, but this is default */
01288         /* call after loading the startup.blend so we can read U.tempdir */
01289         BLI_init_temporary_dir(U.tempdir);
01290 
01291 #ifdef WITH_SDL
01292         BLI_setenv("SDL_VIDEODRIVER", "dummy");
01293 #endif
01294     }
01295     else {
01296         BLI_argsParse(ba, 3, NULL, NULL);
01297 
01298         WM_init(C, argc, (const char **)argv);
01299 
01300         /* don't use user preferences temp dir */
01301         BLI_init_temporary_dir(NULL);
01302     }
01303 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
01304 
01311     // TODO - U.pythondir
01312 #else
01313     printf("\n* WARNING * - Blender compiled without Python!\nthis is not intended for typical usage\n\n");
01314 #endif
01315     
01316     CTX_py_init_set(C, 1);
01317     WM_keymap_init(C);
01318 
01319     /* OK we are ready for it */
01320     BLI_argsParse(ba, 4, load_file, C);
01321 
01322     BLI_argsFree(ba);
01323 
01324 #ifdef WIN32
01325     while (argci)
01326     {
01327         free(argv[--argci]);
01328     }
01329     MEM_freeN(argv);
01330     argv = NULL;
01331 #endif
01332 
01333 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
01334     return 0; /* keep blender in background mode running */
01335 #endif
01336 
01337     if (G.background) {
01338         /* actually incorrect, but works for now (ton) */
01339         WM_exit(C);
01340     }
01341     else {
01342         if ((G.fileflags & G_FILE_AUTOPLAY) && (G.f & G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC)) {
01343             if (WM_init_game(C))
01344                 return 0;
01345         }
01346         else if (!G.file_loaded) {
01347             WM_init_splash(C);
01348         }
01349     }
01350 
01351     WM_main(C);
01352 
01353     return 0;
01354 } /* end of int main(argc,argv) */
01355 
01356 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
01357 void main_python_exit(void)
01358 {
01359     WM_exit((bContext *)evil_C);
01360     evil_C = NULL;
01361 }
01362 #endif
01363 
01364 static void error_cb(const char *err)
01365 {
01366     
01367     printf("%s\n", err);    /* XXX do this in WM too */
01368 }
01369 
01370 static void mem_error_cb(const char *errorStr)
01371 {
01372     fputs(errorStr, stderr);
01373     fflush(stderr);
01374 }
01375 
01376 static void setCallbacks(void)
01377 {
01378     /* Error output from the alloc routines: */
01379     MEM_set_error_callback(mem_error_cb);
01380 
01381 
01382     /* BLI_blenlib: */
01383 
01384     BLI_setErrorCallBack(error_cb); /* */
01385 // XXX  BLI_setInterruptCallBack(blender_test_break);
01386 
01387 }
